intro: Corispermum patens, commonly known as the wandering sand plant, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that store water, adapting to harsh desert environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in areas with minimal rainfall. Due to its hardy nature, it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and preventing soil erosion.
